result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Cummings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS. Sentence credit of 25 Days granted, if revoked. Court will allow transfer to the County in which the defendant resides.
Court will allow transfer to the County in which the defendant resides,

miscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Make best efforts to Maintain/Obtain full time employment, schooling or a combination of the two.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Cummings

defendant.name: Cummings, Christopher
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia

2:12 PM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Cummings in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Christopher Cummings.  Court notes defense filed a motion to modify bond and confirms parties are prepared to proceed with the motion.  Atty. Griffis presents arguments, he is asking bond be modified to just a signature bond.  State objects and presents arguments.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant the motion to modify bail in part.  Court will order the cash bond lowered to $1500.00 with the previously ordered conditions.  Court will also maintain the previously scheduled plea/sentencing hearing set for 08/26/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Bail/bond hearing on August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Cummings in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Christopher Cummings. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.    Bail remains as fixed.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:42 PM Defendant Christopher Cummings in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.  Defendant to fill out the Petition and bring it back to Court this Friday.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

MINUTES UPDATED 08/02/2022 2:57 PM - Court is notified the defendant currently has an outstanding warrant in Milwaukee County case 22CF2014.  
Court conducts colloquy with the parties in regards to the pending case in Milwaukee.  
The State is requesting cash bail be imposed and presents arguments.
Attorney Herbers objects to any change in the signature bond stating the defendant intends to address the case in Milwaukee County and to give him the opportunity to do so.
The Court has had the opportunity to review further information and places findings on the record.
The Court will modify bail and converts the signature bond to cash bail in the amount of $3,500.00.
Court removes the status of counsel date for Friday and will re-set this matter to tomorrow for status of counsel.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
